sen.j: 大元帥法（だいげんすいほう/だいげんのほう）は、密教における大法（呪術）の1つ。
sen.e: Daigen Suiho is one of the magic rituals of esoteric Buddhism.

sen.j: 大元帥明王を本尊として、怨敵・逆臣の調伏、国家安泰を祈って修される法で、839年（承和 (日本)6年）常暁が唐から法輪寺 (斑鳩町)に伝えた物。
sen.e: Daigen Suiho is a ritual in which practitioners pray to an image of Daigensui Myoo for the defeat of enemies and traitors as well as the security of the nation that was introduced to Japan's Horin-ji Temple (Ikaruga-cho) from Tang Dynasty China by Jogyo in the year 839.

sen.j: 以来、毎年正月8日から17日間宮中で行われるようになった。
sen.e: It was subsequently practiced at the imperial palace from the 8th to the 17th day of the first month of every new year.

sen.j: この法は宮中のみで行われ、臣下がこの法を修めることは許されなかった。
sen.e: This ritual was held only within the imperial palace and it was not permitted to be practiced by retainers.

sen.j: 長徳元年（995年）に起きた長徳の変では、内大臣藤原伊周がこれを行ったという口実により大宰府に左遷された。
sen.e: The Dazai-fu (local government office in Kyushu region) prohibited the ritual based on the excuse that it was performed by FUJIWARA no Korechika, Minister of the Interior during the Chotoku Incident that broke out in the year 995.
